intro: Piper longamentum, commonly known as the long-tailed pepper or longamentum pepper, is a climbing vine native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Piperaceae family, which includes many species of pepper plants. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that develop into elongated, slender fruits. The fruits are typically harvested when they turn dark purple, and they are used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Its botanical structure includes compound leaves with opposite arrangement and a unique, aromatic compound found in its fruits.
